catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 904
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: gray-blue blue bowl with decorative willow trees, swimming birds, and reeds encircling three flowers at center; painted band around top edge; wide floral band on outer walls
medium: Porcelaneous stoneware with inlaid design under celadon glaze
text: The inside of this bowl features a pictorial design of water birds, probably geese, swimming alongside weeping willow trees and reeds. The inlaid designs seen on this bowl and on the covered box displayed nearby were created by carving the design into the clay and then infilling it with white and black slip before glazing the entire surface and firing.
title: Bowl with waterfowl, willows, and reeds
